metadata.title: CVE-2022-2961 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s PLP Rose functionality in the way a user triggers a race condition by calling bind while simultaneously triggering the rose_bind() function. This flaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privileges on the system.

notes.note: sbeattie> this is not addressed by 2df91e397d85 ("net: rose: add netdev ref tracker to 'struct rose_sock'") (v6.0-rc1) according to Red Hat. unfixed upstream as of 2023.01.10

criterions.comment: linux package in kinetic is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2023.01.10').
